result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew S Barker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew S Barker in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter by zoom video for Matthew S Barker.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court in trial. Case adjourned via e-mail with clerk.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defense counsel requested status conference adjournment due to confidential reasoning.  Court grants adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 and 10:00 am.

Defendant Matthew S Barker in court, appear by video with attorney Allison Marie Ritter, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Reseved Judge John Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned Reseved Judge John Franke.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew S Barker in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Ritter is out ill. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Matthew S Barker in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an indigency hearing. Defense reports that the indigency hearing is no longer needed due to defendant hiring defense counsel. Defense requested that case go back to preliminary hearing court for a plreliminary hearing. Case adjourned to PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing on May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Matthew S Barker in court.  Matthew S Barker appeared by video Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case set for preliminary hearing.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew S Barker
Current: 1400 Northview Rd, Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 04-13-2022)
Prior: 150 Main Street,102, Pewaukee, WI 53072

Court ordered $1000 signature bond to be transferred from 21CT1706 to this case.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Matthew S Barker in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/24/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/24/22 @ 1p
